rooms.description: Spacious open-plan living area featuring exposed concrete walls and robust steel structures embodying Brutalist aesthetics. Vastu principles applied by orienting the main entrance towards the east to harness positive energy.
features: large windows for ample natural light

rooms.description: Functional kitchen with integrated appliances and exposed concrete finishes. Vastu compliant placement ensuring balance between work and social space.
Dining area adjacent to the living room and kitchen, offering a communal space for gatherings.
Private master bedroom designed with a quiet retreat in mind. Placed towards the north side of the apartment as per Vastu recommendations to enhance calm and restful energy.
Modern bathroom attached to the master bedroom, offering convenience with a minimalist design.
Study area designed for quiet work and creativity. Strategically placed to benefit from natural light without glare.
Compact utility room housing appliances and storage, ensuring smooth workflow.

openings.description: Main entrance designed as a welcoming threshold. Placed east-facing to align with Vastu principles, ensuring an influx of positive energy into the home.
Large windows installed on the north side to maximize natural light and offer scenic views of the garden.
Additional openings or vent placements facing west, accommodating cross ventilation while considering local building norms for West-facing plots.

notes: This floor plan incorporates Brutalist design principles with a split-level layout optimized for the given plot dimensions (50x80 feet). The large garden is integrated into the design to enhance outdoor living spaces. The plan ensures adherence to local building norms and Vastu principles, particularly in the positioning of rooms and openings.
